learning_outcomes.description: Develop an appreciation of key professional and ethical responsibilities relevant to the field of psychology.
Demonstrate a range of core clinical competencies required for clinical practice in the scientist-practitioner tradition.
Demonstrate familiarity with the provision of evidence-based psychological treatments and assessments for clients presenting with a range of psychological, behavioural, and cognitive problems.
Understand and respond to therapeutic process issues, utilising in particular, self-reflective practice.

assessments.assessment_title: Observation of clinical interaction - minimum of 4
assessments.task_description:
At least four recordings of the provisional psychologist's sessions with clients is presented to the supervisor for analysis and to be viewed during the supervision session to allow for in-person reflection to occur. The supervisor and the provisional psychologist should complete the appropriate video reflection for the element being viewed (forms available viat the Blackboard site). All video reflections must be submitted via email to the course coordinator prior to completion of the placement (i.e., by the time of submission of the end-review paperwork).

 

The elements to be reflected on include:

- Microskills

- Psychoeducation

- Case conceptualisation/formulation

- Therapeutic procedure
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit, via email, the Word doc versions of the documents to the Course Coordinator.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Mid Placement Review is completed by the provisional psychologist and their supervisor reflecting on the development of key clinical skills and overall case management in relation to the AHPRA competencies. Please submit all documents to the course coordinator via email. Word format is preferred so that the course coordinator can add comments and sign off as applicable.

Documents to be completed and emailed include:

  • Mid-review form
  • Mid-placement checklist (all elements to be signed off before submission)
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit, via email, the Word doc versions of the documents to the Course Coordinator.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The MSAT is a competency-based exam in which provisional psychologists will be required to demonstrate core clinical competencies across a series of key competency areas including therapeutic procedures, process issues, and assessment considerations.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
The End-placement review is due at the end of the first placement (7th August, 5pm) and is completed by the provisional psychologist and their supervisor reflecting on the development of key clinical skills and overall case management in relation to the AHPRA competencies. Please submit all documents to the course coordinator via email. Word format is preferred so that the course coordinator can add comments and sign off as applicable.


Documents to be completed and emailed include:

  • End-review form
  • End-placement checklist (all elements to be signed off before submission)
  • Supervisory relationship questionnaire
  • Logbooks (client hours, supervision hours, other related hours) - provisional psychologists must keep a record of all their activities during placements. This includes client contact hours, supervision hours, and client-related hours. Forms will be provided to ensure that you are collating the correct information for each of these categories.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit, via email, the Word doc versions of the documents to the Course Coordinator.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
On being a psychologist

In this workshop, we will review the placement requirements and explore what it is to be a psychologist (including process issues, engaging in supervision, and exploring the role of competency development).


Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: On being a psychologist In this workshop, we will review the placement requirements and explore what it is to be a psychologist (including process issues, engaging in supervision, and exploring the role of competency development).

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 5 To Exam week 2(23 Mar - 21 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Internship

Client work, supervision, and other-related activities associated with working with clients seeking psychological support. Note that the placement carries on through to early August. More details during the workshop.


Learning outcomes: L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Internship Client work, supervision, and other-related activities associated with working with clients seeking psychological support. Note that the placement carries on through to early August. More details during the workshop.
